quest.name: The Greatest Story Never Told
journal: The realm of Eorzea is filled with countless mysteries, but there is only one which Valiant Hart wishes to solve.

Valiant Hart has asked you to help him locate the secret treasure of Lalafuto III, who ruled the nation of Belah'dia over seven hundred years ago. To that end, you must solve a riddle hidden in an encoded message, which was written by the famed explorer Winebaud. Valiant Hart also makes mention of a man named Yayaroku, who may be able to offer assistance.
Your investigation leads you to a disciple of Winebaud, who entrusts you with the journal of his deceased master. Return to the statue of the Silent King and share your findings with Valiant Hart.

In your absence, Valiant Hart has made further progress in deciphering the encoded message. However, his efforts have yielded yet another riddle, one which you must solve if you wish to locate the treasure you seek.

Through methods mysterious and unknown, you receive a message from the late Winebaud. He praises your efforts to seek out the truth and shares with you a verse of poetry for reasons unknown. Valiant Hart will doubtless wish to hear of these developments.

Valiant Hart is pleased with your progress, but disappointed that Winebaud did not provide any clues as to the whereabouts of Lalafuto III's secret treasure. Having no other leads, he bids you solve the latest riddle he has deciphered.
Once again, the late Winebaud imparts to you a verse of poetry as a reward, albeit one of questionable value. Report your success to Valiant Hart at the statue of the Silent King.

Valiant Hart is bemused by the increasing complexity of Winebaud's riddles, as well as his penchant for rewarding you with poetic verses. Brushing aside that curiosity for the time being, he directs you to his most recent translation, which contains yet another riddle.

Your jewelry triggers an enchantment woven into Winebaud's engravings, allowing you to receive another message from the late explorer. To your chagrin, it contains little more than another verse of poetry. Valiant Hart does not appear to have seen the message, so perhaps you should tell him what you witnessed.

Bemoaning Winebaud's refusal to offer clear and concise directions, Valiant Hart tells you he has finished deciphering the encoded message. However, unlike previous sections, this one does not appear to contain a riddle. But where is the treasure of Lalafuto III, and what must be done to claim it?

With the aid of your copper gorget, you lay claim to the secret treasure purported to be worth one hundred million gil. Valiant Hart snatches it from your hand, his eyes wild with greed, but his expression soon changes to one of disbelief. The “treasure” Winebaud spoke of was a collection of love poems written by Lalafuto III to his paramour, with whom the sultan wished to elope. His quest for phenomenal wealth having ended in utter failure, Valiant Hart cries out to the heavens in rage, cursing the explorer who valued true love above all else.
objectives: Claim the treasure of Lalafuto III.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Elements? Wheels? Bah, it's gibberish! Utter gibberish!

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: <gasp> As I live and breathe, a Warrior of Light! I haven't seen your like in years─not since bloody Carteneau, certainly.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: ...I see you refuse to confirm or deny my assessment. Keeping a low profile, are we? Very well─I shall speak of this to no one. By the by, my name is Valiant Hart. A pleasure to meet you, my ladysir.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Ahhh, look at us! Two veterans, burdened with experiences beyond the common man's ken. I say, we should be friends, you and I! To that end, I shall share with you my reason for being here, and in so doing deepen our bond.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Tell me, have you heard of Winebaud? He was an explorer of some renown ten years ago, though he regrettably retired and passed on not long ago. It is said that he discovered a treasure worth one hundred million gil.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: That's right─one hundred million gil! Winebaud called it the most precious secret of Lalafuto III, who was sultan of Belah'dia some seven hundred years ago.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Just think what we might do with such a treasure! Aye, I say we, for should you aid me in my search, I would gladly share the spoils. What say you?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Should you choose to undertake this quest, you will receive no guidance from the journal or the duty list. You will need to read the text carefully and decipher the clues to determine your next course of action.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Moreover, it may be unwise to rely on other adventurers for assistance, as their clues and objectives may differ from yours.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The path your quest may take and the rewards you may receive are unknown. Yet knowing this, will you follow in the footsteps of Winebaud and seek out the treasure of Lalafuto III?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Follow in the footsteps of Winebaud?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Of course you will. Only a great fool would turn herhis back on phenomenal wealth and everlasting glory! Now then, to the task at hand!

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Upon this statue of the Silent King is writ a message, left to us by Winebaud himself, which I believe will lead us to the treasure. Alas, it is encoded, and deciphering it is no small feat. See for yourself─I have only finished the first passage.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: What is worse, the contents are nigh unintelligible! It appears to be a riddle, but beyond that I cannot say. And so I would turn to you.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: If you solve the riddles I decipher, then together we can claim the treasure of Lalafuto III. A simple arrangement, yes? Then let us begin at once! Look to the statue for the first riddle.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Beg your pardon, did you just say no to one hundred million gil? Well, that is your decision to make─and regret.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: The thaumaturges summoned one of their own from the Ossuary to inspect this message when it was first found. He came and went in less than a bell, having determined at a glance that it wasn't Belah'dian in origin.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Yet the treasure we seek belonged to a Belah'dian sultan...and there must be a reason why Winebaud chose to mark this statue. That fellow─Yayaroku was his name, I believe─may have insight into this riddle.

dialogue.text: Carved upon the statue is a series of strange characters. Next to them, written in chalk, you find Valiant Hart's translation.

dialogue.text:
(-Winebaud's Message-)HO / OSC / BRA / N'S / EM / CE
FIRE / LIGHTNING / WATER / EARTH / ICE / WIND
The wheel must turn anew.

(-Winebaud's Message-)AL / TH / SPI / 'S / RE / TE

dialogue.name: YAYAROKU
dialogue.text: You wish to speak of ancient Belah'dia? It would be my pleasure to converse with a fellow student of history. I─ Wait, this isn't about Winebaud's message, is it?

dialogue.name: YAYAROKU
dialogue.text: Then you must be another wide-eyed treasure hunter searching for the lost treasure of Lalafuto III. <sigh> Winebaud was a skilled storyteller, and you would be forgiven for thinking his tales were all true. Even now, I cannot say if he was lying to us or himself.

dialogue.name: YAYAROKU
dialogue.text: Hm? You say you deciphered his message? Very well, let us hear it.

dialogue.name: YAYAROKU
dialogue.text:
“Fire, lightning, water, earth, ice, wind. The wheel must turn anew.”
The six elements...but the order is wrong.

dialogue.name: YAYAROKU
dialogue.text:
“The spark of Lightning ignites when it strikes, and thus Fire is born.
The heat of Fire renders to ash all that it touches, and thus Earth is born.
The density of Earth shuns sun and harbors cold, and thus Ice is born.
The armor of Ice melts away, and thus Water is born.
”The moistness of Water mists and rises, and thus Wind is born.
The gusts and sighs of Wind gather the clouds, and thus Lightning is born.“

dialogue.name: YAYAROKU
dialogue.text: A passage from Essences & Permutations, in case you were unaware. Anyway, I have no idea what Winebaud meant to say.

dialogue.name: EXPLORERA01437
dialogue.text: At long last...does the wheel turn anew? Are you the one for whom I have waited?

dialogue.name: EXPLORERA01437
dialogue.text: Praise the Twelve! Master Winebaud told me it might be years, even decades, until one came─if someone came, but I swore an oath, so I couldn't─

dialogue.name: EXPLORERA01437
dialogue.text: You don't understand; this is all so exciting! But you're not here for that, or for me. You're here for the treasure, aren't you?

dialogue.name: EXPLORERA01437
dialogue.text: This is Master Winebaud's journal, and it belongs to you now.

dialogue.name: EXPLORERA01437
dialogue.text: No, no, that's not true. It was always yours─you had yet to claim it, is all. Keep it close, fellow explorer! This is only the beginning!

dialogue.name: EXPLORERA01437
dialogue.text: He never told us what it was. The treasure. I think he thought just knowing was enough to put us at risk.

dialogue.name: EXPLORERA01437
dialogue.text: So he hid it, and left his clues so that only an explorer worthy of the prize could ever hope to succeed.

dialogue.name: EXPLORERA01437
dialogue.text: They call him a charlatan, but I know he spoke the truth! It's real, and you'll find it! And then...you'll show it to me, won't you?

dialogue.name: EXPLORERA01437
dialogue.text: Are you...? No, no. Leave me be, traveler.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Forename, you've returned! Tell me, have you solved Winebaud's riddle? Where did it lead you?

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: The journal of the explorer himself! I knew I was right to trust in you.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: I have news to share as well, though it is not quite as uplifting. I have deciphered another passage, only to find myself confronted with yet another inscrutable riddle.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: But I'm sure you'll have no trouble with it, given how quickly you deduced the answer to the first one!

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: You'll find my translation next to the message as before. I'm counting on you, my puzzle aficionado!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you gaze upon the encoded message, you abruptly recall that you have yet to report your latest findings to Valiant Hart.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: The next riddle is waiting for you, my friend. Go and do what you do best!

dialogue.name: MEMENUGU
dialogue.text: ...So if I understand you correctly, a riddle on a statue said I know “the steps”? A riddle written by Winebaud? I'm sorry, but I haven't the foggiest what that could mean.

dialogue.name: MEMENUGU
dialogue.text: I swear, famed explorer or not, that old man was a bloody fool when it came to combat. This “step” nonsense reminds me of the time he tried to critique the form of my Elezen associate.

dialogue.name: MEMENUGU
dialogue.text:
“Two steps forward, one step back. Over and over again, until the end.”
Gods, he said it so many times it's been stuck in my head ever since!

dialogue.name: MEMENUGU
dialogue.text: Looking to hire a few adventurers? No? Well, if you know anyone who is, send them our way.

dialogue.name: JAHELLE
dialogue.text: Hah! Winebaud carved a riddle on a statue...and included my name along with it? I ought to be flattered, but I'm just confused.

dialogue.name: JAHELLE
dialogue.text: This “sums” nonsense reminds me of all the times he argued with me over his bill. Time and time again I would have to show him the calculations, and when I was finished, he would always apologize in the same queer way:

dialogue.name: JAHELLE
dialogue.text:
“I learned the letters of mathematics, but alas, not the grammar.”
I don't know why; a simple sorry would have sufficed.

dialogue.name: JAHELLE
dialogue.text: Welcome, lasslad. Feel free to take any open table.

dialogue.name: ISOUDA
dialogue.text: I know “the truth?” That does not sound like something the Winebaud I knew would write.

dialogue.name: ISOUDA
dialogue.text: He was cantankerous and contrary to a fault. No matter the subject, he would, without fail, hold the exact opposite opinion. Whenever I pointed this out, he would offer the same insufferable retort:

dialogue.name: ISOUDA
dialogue.text:
“The opposite of nonsense is sense.”
I have never been a violent person, but that old man nearly made me one.

dialogue.name: ISOUDA
dialogue.text: Whatever it is, it can wait. My research demands my undivided attention.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Magicked runes float across your eyes, assuming familiar shapes...

dialogue.name: IBUN01437
dialogue.text: (-Winebaud's Message-)Seeker of treasure and truth, I congratulate and bid you welcome.

dialogue.name: IBUN01437
dialogue.text: (-Winebaud's Message-)Who are you, I wonder, and why have you come this far? What drives you to solve my riddles, and what do you expect to find?

dialogue.name: IBUN01437
dialogue.text: (-Winebaud's Message-)You must wonder what kind of man I was as well. Doubtless you have heard stories─some more flattering than others.

dialogue.name: IBUN01437
dialogue.text: (-Winebaud's Message-)But I have rambled enough, and you must be rewarded! Allow me to share with you a verse written by my favorite poet:

dialogue.name: IBUN01437
dialogue.text:
(-Winebaud's Message-)Clandestine rendezvous leave me breathless and wanting
Obsession consumes me, a thirst for the taboo

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A light catches your eye, but on closer inspection, you find nothing of interest.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: A message written in magicked runes? Amazing! Though the content was rather disappointing, now that I think on it. I was expecting a clue to the treasure's location.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Oh, I almost forgot! I've finished translating another riddle. Why don't you go and take a look?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you move closer to the light, it begins to grow dim, as if retreating from your presence. Perhaps you should reconsider your approach.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Eh!? You had to do what to trigger the message? I know Winebaud had some skill with magicks, but that beggars belief!

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: That curiosity aside, why is he continuing to spout poetry? Bah, never mind. For now, let us focus on the next riddle, which I've just finished translating. It's waiting for you, Forename!

dialogue.text: The adventurer returns, asking after a...Winebaud? Yes, I remember now. He requested my assistance in locating a number of items many years ago.

dialogue.name: SESEROGA
dialogue.text: However, his list lacked sufficient information, and I was unable to proceed. Fortunately for you, I am loath to dispose of any documents related to business. Now where did I...? Ah, here we are.

dialogue.name: SESEROGA
dialogue.text: To be fair, it matters not if it were more detailed. A dead man cannot pay a finder's fee, after all.

dialogue.name: SESEROGA
dialogue.text: This Winebaud gave a list to the master of the markets? 'Twas not I, adventurer. Mayhap he meant my counterpart in Gridania or Limsa Lominsa?

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART

dialogue.text: (-Winebaud's Message-)It's a story, you see...but not the one we were told.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: He mentioned the poet, so perhaps his verses contain a clue? I keep turning them over in my head, but to no avail...

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you ask?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Would you repeat the first verse?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Would you repeat the second verse?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Would you repeat the third verse?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Why do you seek the treasure?

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text:
“Clandestine rendezvous leave me breathless and wanting
Obsession consumes me, a thirst for the taboo”

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text:
“Perchance we meet in public, be not a beguiler
Ply me not with honeyed words, and spare me glances alluring”

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text:
“Ere long this torment must end; together we must be
Renounce it all I would, but we must be more discreet”

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Let's just say that during my enlistment in the Flames, I picked up a few bad habits. Expensive habits.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Really, though, what does it matter? If we find it, we'll both be richer than Lord Lolorito!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The strange markings are reminiscent of Winebaud's encoded message, but are too worn to decipher.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you approach the faded markings, you feel the copper gorget around your neck grow warm. Magicked runes float across your eyes, assuming familiar shapes...

dialogue.name: IBUN01437
dialogue.text: (-Winebaud's Message-)Seeker of treasure and truth, I can deny you no longer.

dialogue.name: IBUN01437
dialogue.text: (-Winebaud's Message-)The most precious secret of Lalafuto III, priceless beyond measure, is yours.

dialogue.name: IBUN01437
dialogue.text: (-Winebaud's Message-)Reach within and claim your prize.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A grinding sound draws your attention to a section of the statue, where a small opening has appeared...

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: What was that─ <gasp> The statue! That hole wasn't there before!

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Y-You solved it, didn't you? The final riddle! Then you know where the treasure is!

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: That there, in your hands─that is the sultan's secret treasure? Give it to me, give it to me!

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text:
(-Belah'dian Tablet-)The gods may condemn me, my people forsake me, history judge me a fool
Power and prestige, fortune and fineries─all I would forsake for you
My kingdom may crumble─

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: And it goes on like this. Line after line of...love poetry?

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: These are naught more than the words of some lovesick buffoon to his beloved! Over and over he repeats the same hackneyed phrases, and his desire to “renounce,” to “forsake,” to “abdicate─”

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: “Abdicate the throne...” Wait. Could it be that this was written by Lalafuto III!?

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Many believed that the sultan's wife had him assassinated so that she could claim the throne for herself. Though that would seem the most likely explanation, his sudden disappearance remains a mystery to this day.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Yet if these poems are to be believed, Lalafuto III was madly in love with his paramour, and wished to be free of his royal responsibilities. He was plotting to flee the capital in secret─and may very well have succeeded.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: An ambitious courtier could have used these poems to gain favor with the sultana or her enemies. On one hand, they are arguably evidence that Lalafuto III still lived. On the other hand, one could assert that Memeto the Meek had him murdered for this ultimate betrayal...

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: But why did Winebaud claim the treasure was worth one hundred million gil? Seven hundred years ago he would have been right, but the nation of Belah'dia is no more.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Hm? There's something written here in a different script.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: (-Winebaud's Message-)A love that will echo through the ages. Truly, there is naught more precious in all creation.

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: All those riddles, all those clues─all for this!?

dialogue.name: VALLIANTHART
dialogue.text: Winebaud! You thrice-damned son of a whore! I can't pay off my debts with swiving poetry!
